content.description: Super fun edgy route with great finger slots.  Don't forget your footwork on this one.  Also keep an eye out for the crucial knob near the top!
content.location: 2nd route on the Space Station, to the right of Apollo Mission

content.description: Walk around the right side of the Space Station. There is a small ledge where you can start the climb. Clip a bolt and pull off the deck with wild exposure. Keep cranking up the steep route with good crimps, slopers, and a few jugs thrown in. Fight the pump to the hero clipping jug at the end of the route.
content.location: The side of the Space Station that faces into the gorge.

content.description: This fun arete climb will expose you to the rest of the gorge below Breaks!  The first route up the Space Station was put up via the light of the moon and included a cool view of Venus. Prepare for a crimpy start to a juggy finish.
content.protection: 3 Bolts, small gear between the 1st and 2nd bolt, the climbing is easy! You can also protect the traverse with anything between a .75-#2
content.location: Look for the arete on the left as you approach the Space Station from Pinnacle Overlook.  Be careful of the gully below.  It is a 60ft drop below!

content.description: A tower below the Pinnacle Overlook. A few wildly exposed routes with room for more. The tower faces all directions.
